com.stormpath.sdk.api
Interface ApiAuthenticationResult

All Superinterfaces:
AuthenticationResult, Resource
All Known Subinterfaces:
AccessTokenResult, OauthAuthenticationResult
public interface ApiAuthenticationResult
extends AuthenticationResult

An AuthenticationResult that indicates a client authenticated with your server-side API (eg REST API) using an ApiKey. The ApiKey used to authenticate the request can be obtained via getApiKey().

Different Results

The actual runtime type of of an ApiAuthenticationResult might be more specific, for example, an OuthAuthenticationResult. If you need to react to different authentication result types, you can use an AuthenticationResultVisitor to perform type-specific logic. For example:

 ApiAuthenticationResult result = application.authenticateApiRequest(request);

 result.accept(new AuthenticationResultVisitor() {

     @Override
     public void visit(ApiAuthenticationResult result) {
         //the request was authenticated with HTTP Basic authentication
     }

     @Override
     public void visit(OauthAuthenticationResult result) {
         //the request was authenticated using OAuth
     }

     ... etc ...
 });

Since:
1.0.RC
See Also:
AuthenticationResultVisitor, OauthAuthenticationResult, AccessTokenResult
